greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows in which row n lists the base 3 digits of 2^n in reverse order, n >= 0.
comment: The length of row n is A020915(n) = 1 + A136409(n).
Conjecture 1: The sequence in column k is periodic, with period p(k) = 2*3^(k-1) = A008776(k-1), k >= 1, and in which the numbers 0,1,2 appear with equal frequency, for each k>1.
mathematica: (* Replace Flatten with Grid to display the triangle: *)
xref: Cf. A000079 (powers of 2), A004642 (powers of 2 written in base 3), A008776 (2*3^n).
Cf. A264980 (row n read as ternary number).
Cf. A037096 (numbers constructed from the inverse case, base 2 digits of 3^n).
results.author: _L. Edson Jeffery_, Dec 04 2015
